title: create_calendar_event — create_calendar_event
text: generates dataframe conforms google calendar import requirements. dataframe can saved csv imported desired calendar.

title: create_calendar_event — create_calendar_event
text: import accepted columns: Subject (Required) name event Start Date (Required) first day event Example: 05 / 30 / 2020 Start Time - time event begins Example: 10:00 End Date last day event Example: 05 / 30 / 2020 End Time

title: create_calendar_event — create_calendar_event
code: class_schedule <- get_class_schedule(sheet = "2025 Fall") #> Error in gs4_auth(): Can't get Google credentials. #> ℹ Are you running googlesheets4 in a non-interactive session? Consider: #> • Call `gs4_deauth()` to prevent the attempt to get credentials. #> • Call `gs4_auth()` directly with all necessary specifics. #> ℹ See gargle's "Non-interactive auth" vignette for more details: #> ℹ <https://gargle.r-lib.org/articles/non-interactive-auth.html> calendar_df <- create_calendar_event(class_schedule) #> Error: object 'class_schedule' not found #readr::write_csv(calendar_df, tempfile())
